message_1: What are the possible quadratic residues of $11$ modulo $20$?
message_2:
To find the possible quadratic residues of 11 modulo 20, we need to find all the squares of integers modulo 20 and see which ones are congruent to 11 modulo 20.

We will look at the squares of integers from 1 to 10 (since 20 is even, and the squares of integers from 11 to 19 will be congruent to the squares of integers from 1 to 10 modulo 20).

1² ≡ 1 (mod 20)
2² ≡ 4 (mod 20)
3² ≡ 9 (mod 20)
4² ≡ 16 (mod 20)
5² ≡ 5 (mod 20)
6² ≡ 36 ≡ 16 (mod 20)
7² ≡ 49 ≡ 9 (mod 20)
8² ≡ 64 ≡ 4 (mod 20)
9² ≡ 81 ≡ 1 (mod 20)
10² ≡ 100 ≡ 0 (mod 20)

Now, we will check which of these squares are congruent to 11 modulo 20:

1 ≡ 11 (mod 20) -> False
4 ≡ 11 (mod 20) -> False
9 ≡ 11 (mod 20) -> False
16 ≡ 11 (mod 20) -> False
5 ≡ 11 (mod 20) -> False

None of the squares of integers from 1 to 10 are congruent to 11 modulo 20. Therefore, there are no possible quadratic residues of 11 modulo 20.
